item.title: About
item.description:
Basic Information

  • Undergraduate student of Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen. Majoring in Automation.
  • I call myself A large flappy moth. This nickname comes from Ayu in Arcaea (She’s a bat, though).
  • One of the initiators of HITSZ OpenAuto organization.
  • Skills I have acclaimed: C/C++, Python, Linux, $LaTeX$, SolidWorks, ROS, Arduino, ESP32.
  • I’m learning: STM32, high speed / digital-analog hybrid PCB design.

I don’t have much expertise in the field of computer science. I think I’m more suitable for drawing boards, writing documents, managing files, and mechanical work.

As for the automation major, it has been my dream since childhood, so I will learn what I want to learn at all costs.

Personal Experience

August 2022

Admitted to Harbin Institute of Technology (Shenzhen) to study for a bachelor’s degree in automation.

September 2022

Joined the HITSZ-VEX robotics team, served as leader of the control group. Focused on developing control systems for electronic devices, including robot chassis drive, motor speed controller, etc. Stopped participating in the team’s activities after April 2023.

October 2023

Started to build the HITSZ OpenAuto organization with some friends. Currently responsible for documentation and file management.

October 2024

Proceed to further study in the direction of embedded hardware.

Working Habits

  • üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I work alone and rarely ask for help.
  • ‚è∞ Morning birdüê¶ instead of night owlü¶â. I usually won’t do anything related to study and work after 22:00.
  • üíª VS Code for everything; Windows 11 with WSL2
  • üéß I almost always listen to music when I work.
  • üìß MS Office 365 workflow, OneDrive, OneNote, Outlook.

Hobbies

First I have to say what is not discussed.

  • Movies, usually just one or two cinema visits a year. I really don’t like watching movies.

That’s all of it.

Games

Rhythm Games

Rhythm games are basically the only type of game I’ve played from high school until now, and I rarely touch other types of games, or I give them up after playing for a short time.

Influenced by rhythm games, I became a fan of Touhou Project in the summer of 2023. (It’s 2023 and there are still people who become fans of Touhouüòπ)

I have played almost all mobile rhythm games and have left the novice stage, Played a dozen hours of CHUNITHM and WACCA. osu!mania regular Dan 4.

I have reduced the time on rhythm games to almost zero recently.

FPS

600+ hours of Team Fortress 2.

Electronic Music

I listen to music almost all the time.

The genres I often listen to are Japanese Trance and Drum & Bass. Most of them come from artists from Otographic Music and Diverse System.

You are welcome to discover more of my music collection. You won’t be disappointed. My Netease Music account: CleverBlock123.

Sports

I have been watching üèéÔ∏è Formula One since 2020. However I am not a fan of any team or driver. I just watch races for fun.

I often take a walk or ride bicycles. In spare time I would visit parks, or climb mountains.

Can rhythm games, especially arcade rhythm games be considered as sport?ü§≠
